comments.commentBody: Any woman who votes for Trump ought to have her head examined.
Make that PPPOTUS: Psychopathic Predatory Pervert of the United States.

Tony Schwartz who ghost wrote The Art of the Deal -- and shadowed Trump for close to a year -- has spoken -- spoken about Trump's A.D.D. when the topic is not about him.  Trump is an ego in a fat suit and the 16 or so Republican wannabes during the primaries should have dealt with him honestly instead of holding off in order to get his supporters after he imploded. Marco Rubio called him a cancer and still is supporting Trump because of the close election Rubio is experiencing in Florida.  Politics. Fascinating? Yes. Scary?  Oh, yeah!

replies.commentBody: I know a few men who might talk like that, but certainly none of the men I work with, live with (sons or husband), or associate with. You, Jacky, might need to hang out with men who are more typical of Americans, mostly gentlemen. Those men don't need to "come forward." They are already the majority.

comments.commentBody:
I wonder how many of male readers here never said any vulgar words toward women (or a certain group of people) before. If such saint exists, please come forward.

This election must have been the worst in American history. Both candidates are the worst as well. I really don't understand why many people enthusiastically support one, while denouncing the other.

At least Trump has one sentence right: Make America Great Again. We need make presidential candidates great again before we can see America great again. Where are Lincoln, Roosevelt, Franklin?

Subverting the campaign of the most malevolent, least qualified, distasteful, anti-democracy, Putin-loving lunatic to ever foul our civil society and political process is an act of the highest, distinguished patriotism.

A White House medal ceremony for the brave American who answered the call.
Whatever the result of the debate, Trump has ruined the GOP: Will it ever recover?
Its been clear for a while that Trump is a maelstrom of mendacity, now it turns out he's a vortex of vulgarity.  How many more people will he suck in?

So looking forward to the movie of this campaign. And what a shame that Philip Seymour Hoffman is no longer with us. He would have made such a brilliant Trump.
A sudden emergence of a Michael Bloomberg late entry should be at least thought about. What a break this is for the undeserving Hillary.

replies.commentBody: Out of curiosity, exactly what "vulgar language" and "sexual misconduct" on the part of Mrs. Clinton do you have evidence or? We're all dying to see it.
Hillary is NOT guilty of sexual misconduct. What a ridiculous assertion.

comments.commentBody: Past scandals certainly plague the Clintons.  Both Hillary and Bill are guilty of sexual misconduct and vulgar language. Remember the door swings both ways.  Do not be too anxious to count Trump out.

replies.commentBody:
TonyR

And do you support the criminal Mrs. Clinton?
And sexual assault isn't a crime? The fact that DT committed sexual assault and then bragged that he could get away with it because he was a star sickens me. The man should be in jail.

comments.commentBody: trump never expected to get this far, but the fact that he did says a lot more about his supporters than it does about him. sadly and scarily, the "adorables" are still lining up in support. we're headed for "Idiocracy".

The republican party as an organization is responsible for this debacle; and the republican party as an organization should be punished for it. A major party nominee like Trump must never happen again.

A massive loss will force the republican party to change for the better so let's give them a massive loss. Vote against every single republican on the ballot. Make them change.

This must never happen again.

My support stands firm for Trump! Tell me how many of us have not said some of these things in private.  Trump is a saint compared to Clinton who has repeatedly abused woman and disgraced the country!  Hillary tried to harass those victims! If there was no Blue dress "that woman" would have been crucified by Hillary!  Hillary has abused power, failed policies, a middle-east in total chaos, private e-mail server which she wiped clean "with clothes", for TPP till she announced her candidancy, says something to wallstreet say toatlly different things to mainstreet,...i can go on. We must not elect another Clinton for another 50 years! Vote for Trump if we want to bring manucaturing and jobs, prosperity and strengh back to our country! Hillary had 30 years to do these she is still working on her plan to beast ISIS! Hilllary is a TOTAL failure.

replies.commentBody:
Deborah Long

Ms. Long; Is it OK with you if the "agent for change" is also a criminal? A great example for "women and girls in America."

Sarah,

And your okay with a guy who feels it is his right to sexually assault women and brag about it doing it being President? What a great role model he will make for all our young men. Especially those in uniform. "Go ahead, rape, pillage and sack our enmities cities. We are stronger and greater than they are so it is Okay". That is who you want to be commander in chief?

comments.commentBody:
Increasingly, Trump’s lurid misogynistic behavior reminds American women of Hillary Clinton’s September 5, 1995 speech to the United Nations Fourth World Congress on Women when she declared: “Human rights are women’s rights, and women’s rights are human rights.”

If Hillary Clinton decides tonight that she has won the chess match against this reprehensible GOP candidate by skillfully using his own words to crush him, her win will be historic. But if she decides to take the shot and assume the mantle of “change” in this election, she will tie Mr. Trump and the entire Republican Party to the endemic misogyny – its virulent sexism – that underlies its discrimination against minorities, immigrants, and the LGBT community. The GOP policies are reprehensibly sexist; they consign one half of the American population, 160,000,000 women, to irrelevance. We are ghosts, and our daughters will continue to remain powerless unless the Hillary Clinton of 1995 takes the shot tonight and assumes her rightful place as the agent for change that she has always been for women and girls in America.
The plan is coming right on schedule. Next Pence drops out and Trump nominates IVANKA AS HIS V.P,
My wife is a married woman.  For our anniversary nest year I am not taking her out for dinner and giving her a dozen roses but instead taking her furniture shopping.

Aren't Mr Trump's comments of a decade ago (and even those held against him more recently) the reflection of the vulgarity and coarseness that is on mass media every day? People aren't much *outraged* about the lyrics of much of *rap* and other forms of popular music. I recall how Tipper Gore was soundly condemned when she made ultimately futile attempts to clean up the rampant vulgar sexualization of our culture. I think some of pro assault and denigration of women performers seem to have had places of honor at the White House in recent times.

It all seems like a lot of posturing to me; and what is this about Podesta's e mails being written in Russia? Do the Snowden supporters have a position on this?

comments.userLocation: up in the woods down by the river
comments.commentBody:
One theory holds that Trump's goal all along has been to destroy the Republican Party. If true there is no arguing with his success.

Maybe he felt so guilty about parts of his life that he's acted out on a subconscious plot of hope vs. nihilism.

The GOP have painted themselves into a corner. The origin of this "predicament" began in the 1990's when the GOP began re-building its "foundation" by courting the most conservative (far-right) sectors of the electorate. This foundation was cultivated and cemented by the surging presence of conservative radio talk shows across the air waves...throughout the entire country. This, with the help of local Gerrymandering of the House of Representative seats in conservative-leaning states, created a newly-founded GOP base which is virtually "unchallenged" in areas of the country.
The obvious effect of these developments succeeded in moving the GOP foundation from being a Center/Center-Right Party to one even further to the Right. In the process, the GOP has consolidated its status as a "minority" Party for the Presidential (i.e. General) Elections. Under these circumstances, it will be very difficult for ANY Republican nominee to win a Presidential Election. The Electoral College votes simply don't exist for the GOP if the so-called Red States are to be relied upon for winning Elections.

replies.commentBody: P S Hoffman watching from the afterlife - how could he resist?

comments.commentBody: So looking forward to the movie of this campaign. And what a shame that Philip Seymour Hoffman is no longer with us. He would have made such a brilliant Trump.

If Trump stays in, Hillary wins, and the GOP crumbles and collapses, I'm a  woman who will cry with joy. Tears will flow for the decades of hypocrisy, misogyny and hate. For the birthers, trans-vaginal ultrasounds and vacant Supreme Court Seat. For Mitch McConnell stating in November 2010 that “our top political priority over the next two years should be to deny President Obama a second term.” For the do-nothing Congress and the government shutdown. For every closeted gay GOP legislator who blocked gay rights. For the lunacy that led to shutting down Planned Parenthood clinics. You of the Grand Old Party...you brought this upon yourselves.

The "R" after the Trump name on the ballot stands for "Repulsive". Also Reactionary, Regressive, Repellent, Repugnant, and just plain Revolting. It's what the Republican Party has come to. All that and worse. Sad that in the face of the evidence, not madey-uppie like most of the GOP attacks on their opponents, there remain millions of voters who still think he's Mr. Wonderful and the GOP has the interests of the USA as a core value.

The "grab her" tape is just the beginning. There is much more to come. Trump has no real friends. Just people who are afraid to cross him. Some because they are cowards who have feared blowback. Others because it just wasn't worth it to spend any time proving to others that he's a fool, a fraud, a lech.

As the piling on begins, particularly with the GOP joining in, it's open season on Trump. More stories, videos, audio tapes to come. Promise.

Okay, so where are the women Trump kissed and groped as a "star"?

When Bill Clinton was active in politics (and probably even now) the GOP spent millions of dollars and tens of millions of man hours trying to locate women who would stand in front of a camera and tell the world what he did to them.

Well - where are the women Trump kissed and groped? Surely some of them must have finished spending their hush money.

Unless, of course (and this is my personal assessment) Trump was just lying to Billy Bush - being a compulsive liar, as Trump is, the first assumption about anything he says about himself must be that it is completely untrue - and that there never were any women who would allow Trump to kiss and fondle them without a word being spoken (I mean, if you're a woman, would YOU let Trump kiss and grope you on first meeting?)

And this would be the most delicious irony - Trump being hoist by his own petard, finally crushed in this fiasco of an election campaign by a lie he told himself about himself to impress a younger man.

Then again, if some women have been sexually assaulted by Trump in the manner he described (and it is absolutely sexual assault to grab a woman by her ***** with apparent indifference as to her consent) then the women should come forward and Trump should be arrested and charged.

And on that point - why are people expecting Hillary Clinton to share the stage with a self-confessed serial sexual criminal? Hillary should just refuse.
PPOTUS Trump: Psychopathic Pervert of the United States.

The Bush political family is supporting Hillary Clinton for prez, I hear tell.
Ironic, no?
The Bush name, the one so often used to excuse the broken promises and failures of the Obama admin is supporting, wait for it, the dreaded "leftist" from D.C. Insiderville,
Washington insiders comprise an elite club that does not represent ordinary people. Democrats and Republicans have one thing in common: Their interests and the people's interests are antipodes.
Clinton and Bush have more in common with each other than they have with almost anyone else in America.
Deal with it...
